data.title: Annette Bening

data.text:
Bening at the 83rd Academy Awards 5 Nominations Role Actress Born May 29, 1958 Topeka, Kansas, USA

Annette Bening is an American actress. Bening made her film debut in The Great Outdoors (1988). Her breakthrough role was in The Grifters (1990), which earned Bening an Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress. The biggest critical and commercial success of her career thus far was the 1999 film American Beauty, which won the Academy Award for Best Picture. Prior to becoming a film actress, Bening was a member of the acting company at the American Conservatory Theater in San Francisco. She is married to Academy Award-winning director, writer, and producer Warren Beatty, with whom she has four children.

Nominations[]

63rd Academy Awards, 1990

Best Supporting Actress — The Grifters

72nd Academy Awards, 1999

Best Actress — American Beauty

77th Academy Awards, 2004

Best Actress — Being Julia

83rd Academy Awards, 2010

Best Actress — The Kids Are All Right

96th Academy Awards, 2023

Best Actress — Nyad
